metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6494 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The client in MongoDB uses world-readable permissions on .dbshell history files, which might allow local users to obtain sensitive information by reading these files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mongodb - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
mongodb-clients - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
mongodb-server - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
mongodb-server-core - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mongodb package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1').
